iristk.speech

Interface Endpointer

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Recognizer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    EndpointerRecognizer, EnergyEndpointer

    public interface Endpointer

    • Method Detail

      • startListen

        void startListen()
          throws RecognizerException
        Tells the recognizer to start listen
        Throws:
        RecognizerException

      • stopListen

        boolean stopListen()
            throws RecognizerException
        Forces the recognizer to stop listening. It should be possible to call this function even if the recognizer is not in the listening state. The method should block until the stopping is complete and the recognizer is ready to start listening again.
        Returns:
        true if the recognizer was listening, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        RecognizerException

      • setNoSpeechTimeout

        void setNoSpeechTimeout(int msec)
                 throws RecognizerException
        Sets the maximum length of silence before the recognizer stops and gives a NOSPEECH result
        Parameters:
        msec - the number of milliseconds for the timeout
        Throws:
        RecognizerException

      • setEndSilTimeout

        void setEndSilTimeout(int msec)
               throws RecognizerException
        Sets the end silence threshold for detecting an end of utterance
        Parameters:
        msec - the number of milliseconds for the timeout
        Throws:
        RecognizerException

      • setMaxSpeechTimeout

        void setMaxSpeechTimeout(int msec)
                  throws RecognizerException
        Sets the maximum length of an utterance before the recognizer stops and gives a MAXSPEECH result
        Parameters:
        msec - the number of milliseconds for the timeout
        Throws:
        RecognizerException

      • addRecognizerListener

        void addRecognizerListener(RecognizerListener listener,
                           int priority)
        Adds a listener for recognizer events
        Parameters:
        listener -
        priority - The listeners with the lowest priority will be called first

      • getAudioFormat

        javax.sound.sampled.AudioFormat getAudioFormat()
        Returns:
        The audio format that the recognizer operates on

      • getAudioPort

        AudioPort getAudioPort()
        Returns:
        The audio port used for the endpointer
